sense.name: a contender in a game, e.g., sports, cards
sense.examples: She became a professional tennis player at age sixteen. John is an excellent poker player. Mary's boyfriend is a decent billiards player. We got to meet the baseball players before the game.

sense.name: a performer in a theatrical or musical production
sense.examples: He had a long career on Broadway as a role player. The bass player in that band also sings backup vocals. The players who make up the cast are mostly British-trained actors. The players of a string quartet perform without a conductor.

sense.name: a participant, decision maker
sense.commentary: PLAYER[+person][+participant][+decision] [+group][+participant][+decision] [+role][+participant] Note: can be a person, organization or nation
sense.examples: Bob wants to be a player on Wall Street. (a major participant) Their nation has been only a secondary player in Middle East negotiations. Our firm is considered one of the primary players in the industry.

sense.name: a playback device for audio or video recordings
sense.examples: The price of DVD players has gone down a lot in recent years. My old cassette player finally gave out.
